content: Singaporean politician **Charlene Chen Yijun**[a] (born 1981 or 1982) is a Singaporean politician, university professor, social and consumer psychologist, who was elected to the [Parliament of Singapore](/wiki/Parliament_of_Singapore) in the [2025 general election](/wiki/2025_Singaporean_general_election). A member of the [People's Action Party](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) (PAP), she represents the [Tampines East](/wiki/Tampines_East) division of [Tampines Group Representation Constituency](/wiki/Tampines_Group_Representation_Constituency) since 2025. ## Early life Chen graduated from the [National University of Singapore](/wiki/National_University_of_Singapore) in 2005 with a first class honours degree in [psychology](/wiki/Psychology). She then obtained a [Master of Arts](/wiki/Master_of_Arts) degree in clinical psychology from the [Columbia University](/wiki/Columbia_University) in 2010, followed by a [Master of Philosophy](/wiki/Master_of_Philosophy) degree in marketing from the Columbia University in 2013. In 2015, Chen graduated from the Columbia University with a [Ph.D](/wiki/Ph.D) in marketing. ## Career Since 2015, Chen has been an Assistant Professor with the Marketing Division of Nanyang Business School at [Nanyang Technological University](/wiki/Nanyang_Technological_University). She also serves as deputy director of industry relations and consulting at the Nanyang Centre for Marketing and Technology. She was formerly a police psychologist at the [Singapore Police Force](/wiki/Singapore_Police_Force) from January 2006 to May 2008. ### Political career On 1 May 2024, Chen was appointed a member of the Tampines Town Council for a two-year term. In June 2024, Chen was introduced as a new grassroots leader for the Tampines East ward of [Tampines GRC](/wiki/Tampines_GRC) by anchor minister [Masagos Zulkifli](/wiki/Masagos_Zulkifli), after former MP-in-charge [Cheng Li Hui](/wiki/Cheng_Li_Hui) resigned in 2023 due to an extramarital affair with former Speaker of Parliament [Tan Chuan-Jin](/wiki/Tan_Chuan-Jin). During the [2025 general election](/wiki/2025_Singapore_general_election), Chen was part of the five-member PAP team contesting in [Tampines GRC](/wiki/Tampines_GRC), where the team won 52.02% of the vote in the constituency. ## Personal life Chen is married with two children. ## Notes - Official profile - Charlene Chen on [Parliament of Singapore](/wiki/Parliament_of_Singapore) Preceded by[Baey Yam Keng](/wiki/Baey_Yam_Keng) [Cheng Li Hui](/wiki/Cheng_Li_Hui) [Masagos Zulkifli](/wiki/Masagos_Zulkifli) [Koh Poh Koon](/wiki/Koh_Poh_Koon) [Desmond Choo](/wiki/Desmond_Choo) **Member of Parliament for [Tampines GRC](/wiki/Tampines_GRC)** 2025â€“present Served alongside: **(2025-present): [Baey Yam Keng](/wiki/Baey_Yam_Keng), [David Neo](/wiki/David_Neo), [Masagos Zulkifli](/wiki/Masagos_Zulkifli), [Koh Poh Koon](/wiki/Koh_Poh_Koon)****Incumbent** This article about a politician from Singapore is a stub.
